CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function escapeHtml is used to sanitize the table name before it is inserted into the HTML. However, if the escapeHtml function is not properly implemented, it could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the web page. These scripts could steal sensitive information, perform actions on behalf of the user, or exploit other vulnerabilities in the web application.
